soc.client

Interface MainDisplay

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SwingMainDisplay

    public interface MainDisplay
    A facade for the SOCPlayerClient to use to invoke actions in the main GUI (as opposed to in-game PlayerClientListener): Connect, list games and chat channels, etc. Underlying implementation is SwingMainDisplay.
    Since:
    2.0.00

    • Method Detail

      • getClient

        SOCPlayerClient getClient()
        Returns the overall Client.

      • getGameMessageSender

        GameMessageSender getGameMessageSender()
        Returns this client's GameMessageSender.

      • getGUIContainer

        java.awt.Container getGUIContainer()
        Returns this display's top-level GUI element: Panel, JPanel, etc. Not necessarily a Frame or JFrame.

      • getDisplayScaleFactor

        int getDisplayScaleFactor()
        For high-DPI displays, what scaling factor to use? Unscaled is 1. Use for fonts, components, and window sizes.
        Returns:
        Display scaling factor, or 1 if none or unknown

      • initVisualElements

        void initVisualElements()
        Init the visual elements. Done before connecting to server, so we don't know its version or active SOCFeatureSet. So, most of the Main Panel elements are initialized here but not laid out or made visible until a later call to showVersion(int, String, String, SOCFeatureSet) when the version and features are known.

      • connect

        void connect(java.lang.String cpass,
             java.lang.String cuser)
        Prepare to connect and give feedback by showing a message panel. Stores the given username and password in the user interface.

        Does not make a network connection. Call ClientNetwork.netConnect(String, int) when ready to make the connection.

        User login and authentication don't occur until a game or channel join is requested; at that time, the user interface will read the name and password stored here.

        Parameters:
        cpass - Password text to put into that TextField (obscured)
        cuser - User nickname text to put into that TextField

      • startLocalTCPServer

        void startLocalTCPServer(int tport)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                         java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Setup for locally hosting a TCP server. If needed, a local server and robots are started, and client connects to it, then visually indicate we are in Server Mode and port number. If the ClientNetwork.localServer is already created, it is stopped and restarted. TODO: validate If connected already, does nothing.
        Parameters:
        tport - TCP port number to host on
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If port is 0 or negative
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if already connected to a server
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • readValidNicknameAndPassword

        boolean readValidNicknameAndPassword()
        Read and validate username and password GUI fields into client's data fields. If username is invalid or empty, or we aren't ready to connect in some other way, let the user know what to change.
        Returns:
        true if OK, false if blank or not ready
        See Also:
        askStartGameWithOptions(String, SOCGameOptionSet, Map)

      • hasAnyActiveGame

        boolean hasAnyActiveGame(boolean fromPracticeServer)
        Are there any active games that we're playing?
        Parameters:
        fromPracticeServer - If true, only look through practice server's games, instead of all games with SOCPlayerInterfaces
        Returns:
        True if there are games found which are active (state < GameState.GAME_OVER)
        Since:
        2.4.00
        See Also:
        SwingMainDisplay.findAnyActiveGame(), ClientNetwork.anyHostedActiveGames()

      • askStartGameWithOptions

        void askStartGameWithOptions(java.lang.String gmName,
                             SOCGameOptionSet opts,
                             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> localPrefs)
        Ask server to start a game with options and also set WAIT_CURSOR and status line ("Talking to server...").

        Assumes we're already connected to server, and that nickname, password, hostname are already validated.

        Parameters:
        gmName - Game name; for practice games, null is allowed
        opts - Set of game options to use, or null
        localPrefs - Set of per-game local preferences to pass to SOCPlayerInterface constructor, or null
        See Also:
        readValidNicknameAndPassword()

      • clearWaitingStatus

        void clearWaitingStatus(boolean clearStatus)
        Clear any visual indicators that we are waiting for the network or other action, like WAIT_CURSOR.
        Parameters:
        clearStatus - If true, also clear any text out of the status line.
        See Also:
        showStatus(String, boolean, boolean)

      • clickPracticeButton

        void clickPracticeButton()
        Act as if the "practice game" button has been clicked. Assumes the dialog panels are all initialized.
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • practiceGameStarting

        void practiceGameStarting()

      • setMessage

        void setMessage(java.lang.String string)

      • showErrorDialog

        void showErrorDialog(java.lang.String errMessage,
                     java.lang.String buttonText)
        Show an error dialog which has one button.
        Parameters:
        errMessage - Error message to show
        buttonText - Button text, or null for "OK"

      • showErrorPanel

        void showErrorPanel(java.lang.String err,
                    boolean canPractice)
        After network trouble, show a panel with the error message instead of the main user/password/games/channels panel.

        If we have the startup panel (started as JAR client app, not applet) with buttons to connect to a server or practice, and canPractice is true, shows that panel instead of the simpler practice-only message panel.

        Parameters:
        err - Error message to show
        canPractice - In current state of client, can we start a practice game?
        Since:
        1.1.16

      • enableOptions

        void enableOptions()

      • showVersion

        void showVersion(int versionNumber,
                 java.lang.String versionString,
                 java.lang.String buildString,
                 SOCFeatureSet feats)
        After connecting, display the remote server's version on main panel, and update display based on its active SOCFeatureSet. Not called for practice server. If we're running a server, display its listening port # instead.
        Parameters:
        versionNumber - Version number, like 1119, from server's Version.versionNumber()
        versionString - Version string, like "1.1.19", from server's Version.version()
        buildString - Build number, from server's Version.buildnum()
        feats - Active optional server features; never null. If server is older than v1.1.19, use the SOCFeatureSet(true, true) constructor.

      • showStatus

        void showStatus(java.lang.String statusText,
                boolean statusIsOK,
                boolean debugWarn)
        Show server welcome banner or status text. If status during initial connect includes warning that the server's in Debug Mode, show that.
        Parameters:
        statusText - Status message text from server
        statusIsOK - True if status code is "OK", not an error
        debugWarn - True if server has Debug Mode active
        See Also:
        clearWaitingStatus(boolean)

      • setNickname

        void setNickname(java.lang.String nm)
        Set the contents of the nickname field.

      • focusPassword

        void focusPassword()
        If the password field is currently visible, focus the cursor there for the user to type something.

      • setPassword

        void setPassword(java.lang.String pw)
        Set the contents of the password field.

      • repaintGameAndChannelLists

        void repaintGameAndChannelLists()
        Repaint displayed game list and channel list after a change to their contents.
        Since:
        2.4.00

      • channelJoined

        void channelJoined(java.lang.String channelName)
        Server has sent authorization for client to create and/or join a channel. Client should create a UI to interact with that channel.

      • channelJoined

        void channelJoined(java.lang.String channelName,
                   java.lang.String nickname)
        Another member has joined an existing channel.

      • channelMemberList

        void channelMemberList(java.lang.String channelName,
                       java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> members)

      • channelCreated

        void channelCreated(java.lang.String channelName)

      • channelLeft

        void channelLeft(java.lang.String channelName)

      • channelLeft

        void channelLeft(java.lang.String channelName,
                 java.lang.String nickname)

      • channelList

        void channelList(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> channelNames)
        Server has sent its list of chat channels (or an empty list), so populate and show that list along with the rest of the UI. The server sends the list when the client successfully connects, and it may be empty.
        Parameters:
        channelNames - List of server's chat channels, from server message
        See Also:
        repaintGameAndChannelLists()

      • channelDeleted

        void channelDeleted(java.lang.String channelName)

      • channelsClosed

        void channelsClosed(java.lang.String message)
        All channels are being closed due to server error. Announce error in each joined channel window, then empty the channel list.

      • sendToChannel

        void sendToChannel(java.lang.String chName,
                   java.lang.String mes)
        Send a text message to a channel on the server, or perform a local command like \ignore or \­unignore.
        Parameters:
        chName - the name of the channel
        mes - the message text or local command
        See Also:
        GameMessageSender.sendText(SOCGame, String)

      • printIgnoreList

        void printIgnoreList(SOCPlayerInterface pi)
        Print contents of the current chat ignorelist into a playerinterface's chat window.

      • chatMessageBroadcast

        void chatMessageBroadcast(java.lang.String message)
        Print a broadcast message into all chat channel windows.
        Parameters:
        message - the message text
        See Also:
        PlayerClientListener.messageBroadcast(String)

      • chatMessageReceived

        void chatMessageReceived(java.lang.String channelName,
                         java.lang.String nickname,
                         java.lang.String message)
        For a chat channel, print a received message into that channel's window.
        Parameters:
        channelName - the name of the channel
        nickname - nickname of user sending the message, or ":" for server messages which should appear in the chat area (recap, etc). For ":", the message text will probably end with " ::" because the original client would begin the text line with ":: " from nickname + ": ".
        message - the message text
        See Also:
        PlayerClientListener.messageReceived(String, String)

      • dialogClosed

        void dialogClosed(NewGameOptionsFrame ngof)
        Callback for when a NewGameOptionsFrame is closed, to clear any reference to it here. For example, the "New Game..." button might create and show an NGOF, and keep such a reference to use if that button is clicked again instead of creating another NGOf and having both visible.

      • gameJoined

        PlayerClientListener gameJoined(SOCGame game,
                                int[] layoutVS,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> localPrefs)
        Server has sent authorization for client to join a game. Client should create a UI to watch or interact with that game.
        Parameters:
        game - New game's data received from server
        layoutVS - Optional board layout "visual shift and trim" (Added Layout Part "VS") to use when sizing and drawing the new game's board, or null
        localPrefs - Local prefs relevant to the new game
        Returns:
        A new PlayerClientListener for interacting with that game or its UI

      • gameWithOptionsBeginSetup

        void gameWithOptionsBeginSetup(boolean forPracticeServer,
                               boolean didAuth)
        Want to start a new game, on a server which supports options. Do we know the valid options already? If so, bring up the options window. If not, ask the server for them. If a NewGameOptionsFrame is already showing, give it focus instead of creating a new one.

        For a summary of the flags and variables involved with game options, and the client/server interaction about their values, see ServerGametypeInfo.

        Parameters:
        forPracticeServer - Ask ClientNetwork.localServer, instead of TCP server?
        didAuth - If true, the server has authenticated our username and password; set those input fields read-only.

      • optionsRequested

        void optionsRequested()

      • optionsReceived

        void optionsReceived(ServerGametypeInfo opts)
        Server has sent its game option default values for new games. Called when ServerGametypeInfo.newGameWaitingForOpts flag was set and has just been cleared. Client should show dialog to create a new game which will have game options.
        Parameters:
        opts - Client's game option info, tracking the TCP or local practice server

      • optionsReceived

        void optionsReceived(ServerGametypeInfo opts,
                     boolean hasAllNow)
        Server has sent info about a single game option. If hasAllNow, client should check ServerGametypeInfo.newGameWaitingForOpts and ServerGametypeInfo.gameInfoWaitingForOpts, and if either of these were waiting, show a game info/options dialog for a new game or existing game.
        Parameters:
        opts - Client's game option info, tracking the TCP or local practice server
        hasAllNow - If true, all game option info has now been received by the client. No further options will be sent and any running timeout task related to the game options can be cancelled.

      • leaveGame

        void leaveGame(SOCGame game)
        Callback for when the client player leaves a game and closes its SOCPlayerInterface. Remove that game from list of our PlayerInterfaces, do any other needed cleanup.

      • addToGameList

        void addToGameList(boolean cannotJoin,
                   java.lang.String gameName,
                   java.lang.String gameOptsStr,
                   boolean addToSrvList)
        Add a new game to the initial window's list of games. If client can't join, makes sure the game is marked as unjoinable in the SOCPlayerClient.serverGames list.
        Parameters:
        cannotJoin - Can we not join this game?
        gameName - the game name to add to the list; must not have the prefix SOCGames.MARKER_THIS_GAME_UNJOINABLE.
        gameOptsStr - String of packed game options, or null
        addToSrvList - Should this game be added to the list of remote-server games? True except for practice games, which should not be added.
        See Also:
        SOCPlayerClient.addToGameList(String, String, boolean), deleteFromGameList(String, boolean), repaintGameAndChannelLists()

      • deleteFromGameList

        boolean deleteFromGameList(java.lang.String gameName,
                           boolean withUnjoinablePrefix)
        Delete a game from the list. If it's on the SOCPlayerClient.serverGames list, also remove from there.
        Parameters:
        gameName - the game to remove
        withUnjoinablePrefix - True if game's display name starts with SOCPlayerClient.GAMENAME_PREFIX_CANNOT_JOIN; gameName should not include this prefix
        Returns:
        true if deleted, false if not found in list
        See Also:
        addToGameList(boolean, String, String, boolean)

      • getEventTimer

        java.util.Timer getEventTimer()
        Utility for time-driven events in the client. For some users, see where-used of this and of SOCPlayerInterface.getEventTimer().
        Returns:
        the timer
